wallets.name: SWIYU Wallet
wallets.description: swiyu is the Swiss Confederation's wallet. It can be used to easily and securely request, store and present digital credentials and documents.swiyu can currently be used as part of Public Beta. The aim is to gain experience with the e-ID (digital identity) that will be issued by the Swiss Confederation.

wallets.name: Affinidi Portal
wallets.description: A comprehensive identity and data management platform enabling organizations to issue and verify verifiable credentials with privacy-preserving data sharing.

wallets.name: e-Albania Digital ID
wallets.description: Launch announced for 2026, to be introduced one year before the EU Digital ID Wallet (2027). Technology partner: Idemia. Biometric identification (fingerprint, facial recognition). Goal: Modernization of administration and preparation for EU accession.

wallets.name: Paradym Wallet
wallets.description: A user-friendly wallet for managing verifiable credentials, built on the Credo framework.

wallets.name: Paradym Platform
wallets.description: An enterprise platform for issuing and verifying verifiable credentials, built on the open-source Credo framework.

wallets.name: Apple Wallet
wallets.description: Apple's built-in wallet app for iPhone, supporting payment cards, boarding passes, tickets, and increasingly digital identity credentials like driver's licenses.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Valera)
wallets.description: Open-source wallet "Valera" developed by A-SIT. Migration of eID Austria (~3 million users) and eAusausweis (~1 million users) to the EUDI architecture. One of the first nine countries with a deployed EUDI wallet.

wallets.name: Auth0 Platform
wallets.description: Auth0's experimental mDL and verifiable credentials platform enabling organizations to issue and verify digital credentials integrated with Auth0's identity platform.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (MyGov.be)
wallets.description: Belgium's MyGov.be national EUDI wallet went live in May 2024 following publication of eIDAS 2.0, becoming one of nine EU countries (Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, Czech Republic, France, Hungary, Italy, Poland, Portugal) with deployed digital identity wallet solutions at national level ahead of the December 2026 mandatory deadline for all EU member states. The wallet builds on existing digital identity infrastructure including the eID system and itsme, enabling Belgian residents to register using identity cards or existing authentication methods, with planned expansion to incorporate mobile driving licenses by 2025 and European Health Insurance Card by 2026.

wallets.name: Credenco Business Wallet
wallets.description: A DIIP v4 compliant organizational wallet platform providing full holder, issuer, and verifier capabilities for enterprise digital identity management.

wallets.name: Digital Citizen
wallets.description: Cyprus's Digital Citizen mobile app launched December 12, 2024, following the broader Digital Citizen program initiative, enables citizens to securely store and present biometric identity cards, driving licenses, and vehicle roadworthiness certificates on smartphones using QR code verification technology for scanning and authenticating digital documents with citizen authorization, achieving over 10,000 downloads in initial rollout. The app requires users to have activated and verified CY Login profiles to access government systems and services along with two-factor authentication enabled, working alongside Cyprus's IDMe.cy digital ID system as the country fulfills eIDAS 2.0 requirements mandating EU member states to offer digital wallet options by 2026.

wallets.name: eDoklady
wallets.description: Czech Republic's eDoklady mobile wallet application launched January 20, 2024, developed by the Digital and Information Agency (DIA) and National Agency for Communication and Information Technology, serves as "an important intermediate step" towards full EU Digital Identity Wallet (EUDI) implementation by enabling citizens to store ID cards, passports, driving licenses, health documentation, professional qualifications, and education certificates on mobile devices with over 70,000 downloads on first day. The app provides real electronic documents compatible with pending EUDI Wallet framework rather than mere document images, with central administrative authorities required to accept digital eDoklady credentials from January 2024, other government bodies from July 1, 2024, and all entities performing identity verification from January 1, 2025, positioning Czech Republic as one of the first nine EU countries to deploy national digital identity wallet solutions ahead of the 2026 mandatory deadline.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Denmark)
wallets.description: Denmark's National EUDI Wallet awarded to Nine (Trifork Group subsidiary) by the Danish Agency for Digital Government in a DKK 29 million Phase 1 contract encompasses development starting April 2025, Q1 2026 go-live, and two years of support and continued development. The Digital Identity Wallet will initially enable citizens to obtain digital proof of age and digital ID credentials usable both physically and online without sharing unnecessary personal information, building upon Denmark's existing MitID system that completed transition at the end of 2023. Subsequent project phases will expand functionality to include a wide range of digital credentials complying with EU eIDAS2 regulation requirements.

wallets.name: Digidentity Wallet
wallets.description: An EWC v3-compliant identity wallet from Digidentity, supporting secure digital identity verification and verifiable credentials for government and enterprise use cases.

wallets.name: Veres Wallet
wallets.description: An enterprise-grade verifiable credentials platform built by Digital Bazaar, pioneers of the W3C Verifiable Credentials standard, offering issuer and verifier capabilities.

wallets.name: Truvera Wallet
wallets.description: Personal digital wallet for holding and presenting verifiable credentials, provided by Dock Labs AG under the Truvera brand.

wallets.name: Truvera Platform
wallets.description: A blockchain-based verifiable credentials platform enabling organizations to issue and verify tamper-proof digital credentials.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Estonia)
wallets.description: Estonia's National EUDI Wallet is in development for 2026-2027 deployment to comply with eIDAS 2.0 regulation mandating EU member states to provide European Digital Identity Wallets, building upon Estonia's world-leading e-ID infrastructure established since 2002 with the pioneering national electronic identity card. The wallet will leverage Estonia's extensive digital government experience including RIA's (Information System Authority) coordination of electronic identity and cybersecurity, integrating with existing eID solutions like ID cards, Mobile-ID, and Smart-ID. Estonia's implementation will continue the country's e-governance leadership by enabling citizens to securely store and share verified digital credentials across EU member states while maintaining interoperability with Estonia's established digital ecosystem that has processed over 600 million digital signatures and achieved "high" eIDAS certification.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Finland)
wallets.description: Developed by DVV, coordinated by the Ministry of Finance. Launch end of 2026. Features: eID, QES, later expanded to include various certificates and documents. Participation in POTENTIAL, EWC, and DC4EU pilots.

wallets.name: DIDroom
wallets.description: An open-source decentralized identity platform providing issuer and verifier capabilities with a focus on privacy and user sovereignty.

wallets.name: France Identité
wallets.description: France Identité app launched by French Ministry of Interior entered beta in May 2022 before full public rollout February 14, 2024, with no user limits, enabling citizens to create dematerialized versions of identity cards and driving licenses on smartphones using NFC readers to scan biometric identity cards requiring Android 11 or iOS 16 minimum software. The state-provided digital identity platform generates electronically signed proofs of identity to prevent fraud, authenticates users for FranceConnect government services access, and displays identity cards and Carte Vitale health insurance cards, with plans to expand health card functionality in 2025, positioning France among early adopters of EUDI Wallet-compatible infrastructure preparing for EU Digital Identity Wallet framework implementation by 2030 for uniform mobile driving licenses across Europe aligned with eIDAS 2.0 regulation.

wallets.name: Gataca Digital Identity Wallet
wallets.description: A privacy-first digital identity wallet supporting verifiable credentials and self-sovereign identity with DIIP v4 compliance.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Germany)
wallets.description: Coordination by SPRIND on behalf of the BMDS (Federal Ministry for Digital and Economic Affairs). SPRIND Funke competition for prototype development (15 months, 3 stages). Stage 3 ends September 2025. Partners: BSI (Federal Office for Information Security), Bundesdruckerei (Federal Printing Office), Fraunhofer AISEC, PwC.

wallets.name: Google Wallet
wallets.description: Google's digital wallet for Android devices, supporting payment cards, loyalty cards, boarding passes, tickets, and digital identity credentials.

wallets.name: Gov.gr Wallet
wallets.description: Official Greek wallet app since July 2022. Enables digital ID cards, driver's licenses, disability cards, DYPA cards, and other documents. Fully valid within Greece (not for international travel). Login via TaxisNet or online banking. Under development into the EUDI Wallet.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Greece)
wallets.description: Launch expected in November 2026. Builds on Gov.gr Wallet. Planned use cases: eGov, banking, SIM registration, mobile DL, QES, eRx, travel, education. Participation in EWC and DC4EU pilot projects. Pilot test at Thessaloniki Airport for travel credentials.

wallets.name: Helix ID Wallet
wallets.description: Helix ID launched in 2020 as a German self-sovereign identity (SSI) mobile wallet solution emerging during Germany's innovation competition "Schaufenster sichere digitale Identitäten" (Showcase on Secure Digital Identities), which tested open and user-friendly ID ecosystems including projects ID-Ideal, IDunion, ONCE, and SDIKA. The SSI wallet embodies the decentralized identity principles where users maintain control over their digital credentials and data rather than relying on centralized authorities. Helix ID operates within Germany's SSI framework landscape that includes initiatives like Lissi ("Let's initiate self-sovereign identity") involving twelve German entities working to jumpstart adoption of self-sovereign identity solutions for citizen empowerment.

wallets.name: Hovi ID
wallets.description: Hovi is a Finnish digital identity infrastructure platform founded in 2023 that enables businesses to issue, verify, and manage verifiable credentials at scale. The platform offers Business Wallet API, Cloud Wallet API, Studio (no-code platform), Mobile Wallet, and SDKs supporting multiple programming languages, with compliance for eIDAS 2.0 and integration with EU Digital Identity Wallets across 27+ EU member states. While Hovi itself is not an eIDAS-notified identification scheme, it serves as a technology provider helping businesses integrate with eIDAS-compliant digital identity solutions using self-sovereign identity (SSI) principles and supports SD-JWT and ISO mDoc formats with OpenID4VCI and OpenID4VP protocols.

wallets.name: Hovi Business Wallet
wallets.description: Issue credentials, verify users, and stay compliant in one flow. Replace outdated ID checks with secure, privacy-first identity built for today’s digital world.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Hungary)
wallets.description: Hungary deployed national EUDI Wallet in 2024 as one of nine EU countries (Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, Czech Republic, France, Hungary, Italy, Poland, and Portugal) with digital identity wallet solutions at national level ahead of December 2026 mandatory deadline when all 27 EU member states must ensure European Digital Identity Wallet availability to citizens following implementing acts adopted November 28, 2024. The Hungarian wallet builds on eSzemélyi (electronic personal identity card) infrastructure introduced January 1, 2016, and issued in current form since August 2, 2021, incorporating electronic chip storing biometric data (photo, fingerprints and signature for those over 12) enabling electronic public identification and qualified electronic signatures.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Iceland)
wallets.description: Iceland as European Economic Area (EEA) country alongside Liechtenstein and Norway has been granted one-year extension for EUDI Wallet implementation with December 2027 deadline compared to EU member states' December 2026 requirement, positioning Iceland among thirteen countries embarked on digital ID wallet development journeys at different stages including development, beta testing, or pre-production. The Icelandic government participates in pilot projects involving more than 250 private and public organizations across almost every EU member state as well as Norway, Iceland, and Ukraine to test EUDI Wallet enabling citizens to digitally prove identity and share verified attributes across EU/EEA in secure, user-controlled manner, building on Iceland's existing advanced electronic identification infrastructure including Auðkenni system achieving 97% adoption among eligible population for transition to European Digital Identity Wallet framework under eIDAS 2.0 regulation.

wallets.name: Data Wallet
wallets.description: A privacy-first data wallet focused on GDPR compliance and data exchange, enabling individuals to manage consent and share verifiable credentials securely.

wallets.name: iGrant.io Organization Wallet
wallets.description: An enterprise wallet platform providing complete holder, issuer, and verifier capabilities with DIIP v4 compliance for organizational digital identity management.

wallets.name: UniMe
wallets.description: A privacy-focused identity wallet supporting DIIP v4 interoperability profile, enabling secure storage and sharing of verifiable credentials.

wallets.name: Impierce UniTrust
wallets.description: An open-source organizational identity agent providing complete holder, issuer, and verifier capabilities built on the UniCore framework.

wallets.name: DigiLocker
wallets.description: Government of India digital document wallet for storing, accessing, sharing, and verifying official documents and certificates.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Ireland)
wallets.description: Ireland's National EUDI Wallet is in development to comply with eIDAS 2.0 regulation, which mandates all EU member states to provide European Digital Identity Wallets by 2026. The wallet will enable Irish citizens to securely store and share verified digital credentials, access online services across the EU, and authenticate their identity for both public and private sector services. Ireland's implementation will integrate with the country's existing MyGovID authentication system and align with the EU-wide interoperability framework for cross-border digital identity recognition established under eIDAS Regulation 2024/1183.

wallets.name: IT Wallet
wallets.description: Italy's IT-Wallet pilot launched October 23, 2024, with 50,000 users selected through IO app, achieving full nationwide deployment December 4, 2024, making Italy the first EU member state to fully deploy an EUDI Wallet under eIDAS 2.0 framework with 1.76 million digital driving licenses and 2.04 million digital health cards added within the first week. The comprehensive digital identity wallet integrated into PagoPa's IO app enables Italian citizens to securely store and present digital versions of identity cards, driving licenses, health cards, and European Disability Cards on smartphones, with plans to expand to educational qualifications and professional licenses while serving as foundation for Italy's digital government modernization strategy aligned with EU Digital Identity Wallet Architecture Reference Framework specifications.

wallets.name: Identfy
wallets.description: Identfy is Spain's first open-source digital wallet solution developed by Izertis S.A. The solution features a two-wallet architecture (Holder Wallet mobile app and Organization Wallet for enterprises) enabling issuance, storage, and verification of verifiable credentials with Zero-Knowledge-Proof protocols for selective disclosure, biometric authentication, and DLT-based security, supporting use cases in healthcare, education, border control, and financial services across EU member states. Izertis actively participates in major EU digital identity projects including DC4EU consortium, EBSI-VECTOR project, and WE BUILD Large Scale Pilot.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Latvia)
wallets.description: Latvia's National EUDI Wallet is in development to comply with eIDAS 2.0 regulation mandating EU member states to provide European Digital Identity Wallets by 2026-2027. The wallet will build upon Latvia's existing eID infrastructure including the Personas apliecība (eID card) and eParaksts services, enabling citizens to securely store and share verified digital credentials across EU member states. Latvia's implementation will integrate with the cross-border eIDAS ecosystem, leveraging the country's experience as the second Nordic-Baltic state to achieve EU-wide e-service recognition and continuing Latvia's leadership in digital identity interoperability.

wallets.name: Lissi ID-Wallet
wallets.description: A privacy-focused digital identity wallet developed by Neosfer, a subsidiary of Commerzbank, enabling users to securely store and share verifiable credentials.

wallets.name: Lissi ID-Wallet Connector
wallets.description: An enterprise integration platform enabling organizations to hold, issue, and verify verifiable credentials, connecting with the Lissi ecosystem.

wallets.name: MATTR VII
wallets.description: An enterprise identity infrastructure platform providing comprehensive issuer and verifier capabilities for verifiable credentials at scale.

wallets.name: Meeco SVX Platform
wallets.description: A personal data and identity management platform enabling organizations to hold and issue verifiable credentials with zero-knowledge proof capabilities.

wallets.name: Microsoft Authenticator
wallets.description: Microsoft's authentication app that also supports verifiable credentials through Microsoft Entra Verified ID, enabling passwordless sign-in and digital identity verification.

wallets.name: Mini-Wallet (Finland)
wallets.description: The Finnish government's digital identity wallet enabling organizations and citizens to hold and issue verifiable credentials as part of the national digital identity infrastructure.

wallets.name: Inji Wallet
wallets.description: An open-source modular identity wallet for individuals, supporting holding and presenting verifiable credentials as part of national-scale digital identity deployments.

wallets.name: Inji Platform
wallets.description: A set of open source modules by MOSIP, enabling organizations and governments to issue, verify, and manage verifiable credentials at scale.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Netherlands)
wallets.description: Netherlands' public NL-wallet EUDI implementation developed by Ministry of Interior and Kingdom Relations (BZK) aims to offer inclusive and dependable digital solution prioritizing user-friendliness, accessibility, privacy, and security by late 2026, with various sectors preparing to accept wallets by 2027. The Dutch government creates nationwide version maintaining user control over data where citizens decide what information to keep, when to use it, and whom to share it with, preventing sharing more details than needed for services, building on existing DigiD national eID and eHerkenning business authentication schemes with several public service providers already testing wallet functionality in real-world scenarios, positioning Netherlands among EU countries advancing toward voluntary adoption of European Digital Identity Wallet framework ahead of December 2026 mandatory availability deadline.

wallets.name: Orbit Enterprise
wallets.description: An enterprise digital identity platform providing verifier and issuer capabilities for organizations to manage and issue verifiable credentials.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Norway)
wallets.description: Norway as European Economic Area (EEA) country alongside Iceland and Liechtenstein has December 2027 deadline (one-year extension compared to EU member states' December 2026 requirement) to offer citizens EU Digital Identity Wallet, led by Digdir (Norwegian Digitalisation Agency) coordinating NOBID (Nordic-Baltic eID Project) multi-country consortium including Denmark, Germany, Iceland, Italy, and Latvia focusing on payments use case leveraging existing payment infrastructure. BankID participates in first phase of European Identity Wallet work through involvement in two consortia (EUDI Wallet Consortium EWC and Digital Credentials for Europe DC4EU) piloting EUDI wallet functionality, building on Norway's advanced digital infrastructure where more than 90% of citizens have access to eID with millions using digital services daily and 75% (4.1 million) Norwegians using Vipps payment tool, positioning Norway as leader in digital payments and eID adoption preparing for EUDI wallet integration with financial institutions obliged to accept wallet as official identification method from end of 2027.

wallets.name: CredIssuer
wallets.description: CredIssuer is a digital credentialing platform that enables institutions and governments to issue tamper-proof, verifiable certificates in real time.

wallets.name: mObywatel
wallets.description: Poland's mObywatel mobile application created in 2017 introduced electronic prescriptions and mobile driving licenses (mDL) in 2020, significantly boosting popularity as gateway into digitalization process storing e-documents including driving licenses, diplomas, COVID certificates, and ID cards, with mObywatel 2.0 mDowód digital ID becoming fully equal to plastic counterpart from September 2023 as biggest EU country where eID achieved full legal equivalence with traditional identification. The government develops mObywatel 3.0 application for European Digital Identity Wallet (EUDI Wallet) targeting full eIDAS 2.0 compliance by 2026, positioning Poland as one of nine countries (Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, Czech Republic, France, Hungary, Italy, Poland, Portugal) with digital identity wallet solution deployed at national level by building on existing digital ID app infrastructure and adjusting to integrate required EUDI wallet capabilities ahead of December 2026 mandatory deadline.

wallets.name: gov.pt (formerly id.gov.pt)
wallets.description: Portugal's ID.gov.pt (now gov.pt) mobile digital wallet officially launched January 2019 as pioneer wallet application managed by AMA (Administrative Modernization Agency) enabling citizens to keep and consult ID cards anytime anywhere through active Digital Mobile Key (CMD) with High Level of Assurance required for authentication and all app actions. The wallet achieved 548,338 app downloads by April 2021 (375,284 Android, 173,054 iOS) with 793,948 downloaded cards including Citizen Card (390,966), driving license (337,173), ADSE health card (65,809), plus Employee Card, Defense Digital Card, Former Combatant Card, Single Port Card, ADM Card, and Youth Card, supporting over 80% population eID usage making nearly 13 million authentications per year, establishing Portugal as European leader in digital identity wallet adoption ahead of eIDAS 2.0 framework and EUDI Wallet deployment requirements.

wallets.name: Yivi
wallets.description: An open-source privacy-friendly identity wallet (formerly IRMA) developed by the Privacy by Design Foundation, enabling attribute-based credentials with selective disclosure.

wallets.name: Procivis One Wallet
wallets.description: A Swiss personal identity wallet app enabling secure storage and presentation of verifiable credentials for individuals, built on the Procivis One platform.

wallets.name: Procivis One
wallets.description: A Swiss enterprise identity platform providing issuer and verifier capabilities for verifiable credentials with a focus on privacy and compliance.

wallets.name: Scytales ID Wallet
wallets.description: An enterprise-grade digital identity wallet for secure credential management, supporting various verifiable credential formats.

wallets.name: Scytales EU Reference Wallet
wallets.description: An organizational platform based on the EU Digital Identity Wallet reference implementation, providing issuer and verifier capabilities.

wallets.name: SICPA Digital Trust Suite
wallets.description: An enterprise digital trust platform from SICPA providing issuer and verifier capabilities for secure credential management, building on their expertise in security authentication.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Slovakia)
wallets.description: Slovakia's National EUDI Wallet is in development to meet eIDAS 2.0 mandates requiring all EU member states to provide European Digital Identity Wallets by 2026-2027. The wallet will enable Slovak citizens to securely manage verified digital credentials, authenticate across EU services, and engage in secure digital transactions for both government and commercial applications. Slovakia's implementation will build upon the country's existing electronic identity infrastructure and integrate with the EU-wide EUDI Wallet ecosystem for seamless cross-border identity verification compliant with eIDAS Regulation 2024/1183.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Slovenia)
wallets.description: Slovenia develops national EUDI Wallet as one of thirteen EU countries (Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Latvia, Netherlands, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden) embarked on digital ID wallet development at various stages including development, beta testing, or pre-production, meeting December 2026 deadline for all 27 EU member states to ensure European Digital Identity Wallet availability to citizens following first implementing regulations published December 4, 2024, entering force 20 days later. The Slovenian wallet builds on existing smartcard ID infrastructure, mobile ID systems, and electronic certificates to support personal identification data, university diplomas, driver's licenses, electronic certificates and attestations of attributes with secure authentication, document storage, sharing capabilities, and digital signing, preparing for 2027 requirements when banks, telecom operators, and major online service providers must accept EUDI Wallet as valid authentication and identity verification across EU member states.

wallets.name: Cartera Digital Beta
wallets.description: Spain's Cartera Digital Beta presented by Minister José Luis Escrivá in July 2024 is a mobile digital wallet pilot implementing an age verification system for accessing adult content using government-issued age credentials based on users' ID cards stored in the system, with availability for all citizens by end of summer 2024. The wallet generates 30 pairs of keys monthly for one-time identity verification through a double-blind system protecting privacy with double authentication preventing minors from accessing through adult devices, selected by the EU for a pilot project due to Spain's advanced work in developing age-assurance applications. As part of eIDAS2 standard requiring content platforms to accept European digital identity wallets by October 2027, Cartera Digital Beta will expand beyond age assurance to store municipal registries, university/non-university degrees, and ID documents, positioning Spain among EU countries piloting EUDI wallet functionality ahead of mandatory implementation.

wallets.name: Sphereon Wallet
wallets.description: Enterprise-grade digital identity wallet with support for multiple credential formats and protocols.

wallets.name: Sphereon VDX Platform
wallets.description: An enterprise organizational wallet platform providing holder, issuer, and verifier capabilities with DIIP v4 compliance.

wallets.name: Spherity Business Wallet
wallets.description: An enterprise identity wallet specializing in supply chain and pharmaceutical industry use cases, providing complete holder, issuer, and verifier capabilities.

wallets.name: SpruceKit Showcase
wallets.description: Reference implementation of a lightweight personal wallet and verifier app, built on the open-source SpruceKit Mobile SDK, for receiving and presenting verifiable credentials and mdocs.

wallets.name: National EUDI Wallet (Sweden)
wallets.description: Sweden's national EUDI Wallet developed by DIGG (Agency for Digital Government) with recommended Swedish open model allowing both private and public operators as issuers of digital identity wallets, building on BankID infrastructure dominating market with over 8.5 million users as most widely used eID in Sweden and only one usable for identifying to payment service providers and authenticating payments. The EWC project co-founded by Swedish government agencies including DIGG, Companies Registration Office (Bolagsverket), Research Council (Vetenskapsrådet), and Sunet (University Computer Network) participates in two consortia (EUDI Wallet Consortium EWC and Digital Credentials for Europe DC4EU) piloting EU Digital Identity Wallet, positioning Sweden to meet December 2026 deadline for offering every citizen European Digital Identity Wallet with financial institutions, telecom operators, and major online service providers required to accept EUDI Wallet as valid authentication and identity verification from 2027 onward.

wallets.name: Altme
wallets.description: A self-sovereign identity wallet for managing verifiable credentials, supporting decentralized identity standards and blockchain-based credentials.

wallets.name: Talao Wallet
wallets.description: Enterprise-grade identity wallet supporting verifiable credentials and decentralized identity protocols.

wallets.name: TOPPAN Wallet
wallets.description: An enterprise security wallet supporting digital identity and verifiable credentials with DIIP v4 compliance.

wallets.name: Truid
wallets.description: Truid is a Stockholm-based identity verification company founded in 2021, providing eIDAS-compliant KYC, fraud prevention, and digital signatures, with solutions built for the EU Digital Identity Wallet (EUDI Wallet) specification. On March 14, 2025, Truid was acquired by Kivra (Sweden's leading digital communication platform) to develop a next-generation identity wallet aligned with eIDAS 2.0. Truid focuses on identity verification and wallet technology rather than traditional eID authentication like BankID.

wallets.name: UAegean Stack (Cyclades Fast Ferries)
wallets.description: An open source solution developed by the University of the Aegean providing holder, issuer, and verifier capabilities for the EWC LSP, demonstrated in the Cyclades Fast Ferries use case.

wallets.name: Heidi Wallet App
wallets.description: A DIIP v4-compliant Swiss identity wallet supporting verifiable credentials for secure digital identity management.

wallets.name: Diia (Дія)
wallets.description: Ukraine's Diia ("Action" in Ukrainian) launched in 2020 by Ministry of Digital Transformation led by Minister Mykhailo Fedorov serves as mobile app and online portal acting as one-stop shop for public services and wallet for digital documents with same legal status as paper originals including digital passports and driving licenses, providing access to over 130 government services for approximately 18.5 million users (around half adult population). The comprehensive GovTech platform implemented by UNDP Ukraine with funding from Government of Sweden (SweMFA) through DIA Support Project builds on UNDP's experience in administrative service reform, digitalisation, and public administration process re-engineering, successfully demonstrating digital government resilience during crisis with Ukraine now exporting digital transformation know-how to other countries including Estonia adapting Diia to their needs, establishing Ukraine as leader in government digital innovation despite challenging circumstances.

wallets.name: VIDwallet
wallets.description: An EWC v3-compliant digital identity wallet enabling secure storage and presentation of verifiable credentials for individuals.

wallets.name: ValidatedID Platform
wallets.description: An enterprise digital identity platform providing complete holder, issuer, and verifier capabilities for organizational credential management.

wallets.name: Verimi
wallets.description: Verimi launched in 2017 in Berlin as a digital identity platform founded by a consortium of 25 major German companies including Deutsche Bank, Allianz, Axel Springer, Bundesdruckerei, Deutsche Bahn, Lufthansa, Deutsche Telekom, Volkswagen, Mercedes-Benz, Samsung, and insurance companies (via GMB Systems including Huk-Coburg, Provinzial, LVM, DEVK, Zurich). In November 2022, Verimi merged with Yes (supported by Sparkassen, Volksbanken, and Raiffeisenbanken savings/cooperative banks) to create Germany's unified digital identity ecosystem, combining forces with 25 companies and processing over 10 million transactions in 2022. The merged platform bundles services from both providers to accelerate growth and offer comprehensive identification, ID wallet, and identity verification services from a single source, working with both public institutions (AOK) and private sector partners.

wallets.name: wwWallet
wallets.description: An open-source web-based wallet for verifiable credentials, enabling users to manage their digital identity directly in the browser without installing an app.

wallets.name: Yoti
wallets.description: Yoti founded in 2014 by three Oxford University students enables users to create reusable Digital IDs by adding government-issued identity documents and taking biometric selfies, protected by multi-factor authentication including phone linking, PIN protection, and personal biometrics. The UK's Proof of Age Standards Scheme (PASS) accredited Yoti ID in 2022 alongside Post Office EasyID and Lloyds Bank Smart ID as government-recognized proof of identity and age for buying restricted goods/services, with Yoti becoming one of the first certified Digital Identity Service Providers (IDSPs) under UK's digital identity framework in June 2022. Yoti technology enables Jersey islanders to prove identity for safely accessing government services online as fundamental infrastructure for Jersey's public sector modernization, while serving global markets through Digital ID Wallets and Connect apps supporting interoperable age verification across UK's expanding digital identity network.

wallets.name: eAusweise (Austrian Wallet)
wallets.description: The official Austrian government identity wallet, enabling citizens to store and present digital identity documents and verifiable credentials.

wallets.name: eID.li (Liechtenstein Wallet)
wallets.description: The official Liechtenstein government identity wallet, enabling citizens to store and present digital identity documents and verifiable credentials.

wallets.name: YourD Data Wallet
wallets.description: A data ownership wallet supporting DIIP v4 and EWC v3 interoperability profiles, enabling secure management of personal data and verifiable credentials.
